intro: Ranunculus micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five to seven petals, each petal being narrow and elongated. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three deeply lobed leaflets, and are often covered in a waxy coating. Ranunculus micranthus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
